official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that recently proposed measures that will
			 reduce transparency and public participation at the International
			 Association of Insurance Supervisors (IAIS) should be disapproved by
			 United States representatives to the IAIS.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

should the IAIS adopt the proposed procedures or any similar reductions in transparency, United
			 States representatives to the IAIS should make all appropriate efforts to
			 ensure that proper transparency is restored; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and United States stakeholders, and that United
			 States representatives to the IAIS should regularly communicate with
			 United States stakeholders through timely comprehensive reporting and
			 in-person discussions.

text.#text:
all United States representatives to the IAIS should work to ensure that their activities are
			 transparent to
Whereas heretofore, the procedures of the IAIS were relatively transparent for observers;

Whereas representatives of United States consumer advocacy organizations have just recently been
			 admitted as observers;

Whereas maximum transparency produces the best regulation and the proposed procedures will reduce
			 transparency; and

Whereas United States State insurance regulators who currently provide the largest portion of
			 funding to the IAIS have already publically expressed opposition to the
			 proposed reduction in IAIS transparency: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 735 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that recently proposed measures that will reduce transparency and public participation at the International Association of Insurance Supervisors (IAIS) should be disapproved by United States representatives to the IAIS.
